summary: This is a court order by Judge Alison J. Nathan granting a short continuance of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial from July 2021 to fall 2021. The continuance is granted due to the government's late filing of an S2 Superseding Indictment, which added new charges and an alleged victim, requiring additional defense preparation time. The order balances the defense's need to prepare against the interests of the defendant, victims, and the public in a timely trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose defense counsel requested a continuance of the trial date due to a new superseding indictment.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge who issued the order granting a continuance of Maxwell's trial to fall 2021.

persons.name: Judge Furman
persons.context: A judge presiding over a separate criminal matter involving lawyers who also represent Maxwell, leading to a scheduling conflict mentioned in the order.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell and issued the order regarding her trial schedule.

events.title: Government Files S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: The Government filed an S2 Superseding Indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, adding new charges and extending the timeframe of alleged conspiracies.

events.title: Original Trial Start Date
events.description: The trial in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell was originally scheduled to commence on this date.

events.title: Court Orders Trial Continuance
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order granting a continuance, moving the trial start date from July 12, 2021, to fall 2021.

events.title: Deadline for Joint Trial Date Proposal
events.description: The parties are ordered to meet, confer, and jointly propose a new trial start date to the court by this date.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, referenced as where defendant is detained)
keyFacts: The S2 Superseding Indictment extended the timeframe of the charged conspiracies from through 1997 to 2004 and identified a fourth alleged victim, referred to as Minor Victim-4.
The S2 Indictment added two new charges: Count 5 (sex trafficking conspiracy, 2001-2004) and Count 6 (sex trafficking of a minor or aiding and abetting).

The court granted a continuance primarily due to the significant new burden on the defense from the S2 indictment, requiring review of new discovery, re-review of old discovery, new investigations, and revised trial strategy.

The court rejected longer continuance requests (to January or March 2022) and ordered the parties to propose an early fall 2021 trial date, balancing defense preparation needs against the public interest in a timely trial.
The order notes that Maxwell's trial preparation, and the government's investigation, had been hampered by travel constraints and safety concerns resulting from the COVID-19 pandemic.
